Issues.Title: Request a clone feature with its Angular content attached
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

compiler

### Description

Hi.

I have build an Angular carousel library (on npm [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/ngx-carousel-ease) if you are curious), and I come to the following problem: 
In a carousel, if infinite mode is enabled, new slides will be appended if user surpasses the end (or prepended if the start) of the carousel. I use the Javascript `cloneNode` method, which clones the element, but loses all the Angular attached event, directives, pipes, etc. In other words: if there is for example a translation (with a translate pipe), the translation will be lost.

There is currently no Angular methods / ways available to achieve this. Using a template approach (with *ngTemplateOutlet) is not appropriated, since I would need a **fast, efficient, and synchronous** method as the Javascript `cloneNode` method, because slides can be appended while the user drags the carousel, so I cannot delay their creation or add any "asymmetry" between code execution and template code update (and if slides are prepended, a translation correction has to be done in Javascript, any "asymmetry" would cause an inconsistent UI).

I would need a fast, efficient, and synchronous Angular `clone` method that clone the HTML element as the `cloneNode` Javascript method **WITH** all its Angular elements attached.



### Proposed solution

A method that clone an element as the Javascript CloneNode method and attach all the Angular events, pipes, directives, etc. on the element.

### Alternatives considered

Currently no ways of achieve this within the Angular API.

Issues.Title: Add the ability to remove instance of service after leaving a route
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

Currently, Angular allows service providers to be injected at the following levels:

- Application level
- Routing level for a specific path and its children (our use case)
- Component level

The problem is when we want a single instance of a service to be shared across all child routes of a specific path, but that instance to be destroyed when navigating to a different path that does not use that service. Currently, services loaded on a route are cached for that route for the lifetime of the application.

This can be seen in the linked reproduction, where service instances are not destroyed after navigating to the otherpage route. To achieve this behavior, we need to create a wrapper component that only contains a <router-outlet> and has the services included in the component, which is an unnecessary abstraction in my opinion.

Good article about it:

https://itnext.io/mastering-injectable-services-a-comprehensive-guide-6c2c0f5f48a2

Reproduction:
[Stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-5hzubt?description=An%20angular-cli%20project%20based%20on%20@angular/animations,%20@angular/common,%20@angular/compiler,%20@angular/core,%20@angular/forms,%20@angular/platform-browser,%20@angular/platform-browser-dynamic,%20@angular/router,%20core-js,%20rxjs,%20tslib%20and%20zone.js&file=src%2Fmain.ts,angular.json,src%2Fpages%2Fotherpage.component.ts,src%2Fexample.service.ts,src%2Findex.html,src%2Fpages%2Fhomepage%2Fhomepage-1.component.ts,src%2Fpages%2Fhomepage%2Fhomepage-2.component.ts%3AL5&file=src%2Fmain.ts,src%2Fexample.service.ts,src%2Fpages%2Fhomepage%2Fhomepage-1.component.ts,src%2Fpages%2Fhomepage%2Fhomepage-2.component.ts,src%2Fpages%2Fotherpage.component.ts&template=node&title=Angular%20Starter)

### Proposed solution

I'm not sure if this is the best solution, but perhaps adding an additional hermeticProviders array to the route configuration 
`{path: 'some-route', providers:[], **hermeticProviders**: []}`
 would help create instances that only live for the duration of the route. This would eliminate the need to create an artificial component that doesn't actually serve as a component in this case.

### Alternatives considered

No ideas

Issues.Title: viewChild function doesn't accept generic type for ElementRef

### Description

I just tried out the new `viewChild()` function, with the `{ read: ElementRef }` option. Usually I use `ElementRef` with a generic type, i.e. `ElementRef<HTMLElement>` to have better type safety. I tried to set a generic type:

```typescript
myViewChild = viewChild(MyComponent, { read: ElementRef<HTMLElement> });
```

But this throws me an error:

The `viewChild()` function offers a possibility to set the generic type of the `ElementRef`.

### Alternatives considered

For now I'm overriding the type of the signal, but this looks quite verbose:

```typescript
myViewChild: Signal<ElementRef<HTMLElement> | undefined> = viewChild(MyComponent, { read: ElementRef });
```

Issues.Title: fix(core): generic inference for signal inputs may break with `--strictFunctionTypes`
Issues.Body:
This commit fixes that the generic inference for signal inputs may break
with `--strictFunctionTypes`.

We are not using `--strictFunctionTypes` in all tests, so function parameters are always
checked bivariantly- while in 1P function parameters are checked contravariantly. This breaks
sub-typing and e.g. `InputSignal<number>` is not a subtype of `InputSignalWithTransform<unknown, number>`.

This then causes the generic inference via `ÉµUnwrapDirectiveSignalInputs` to always end up resolving
these generic fields to `never`â€” breaking inference.

Root cause is that the input signal captures the equality function that is exclusively concerned with the `ReadT`. And `ReadT` is never equal, or a supertype of unknown.

https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?#-H3G6PZ5vL40KYJZhg59DeOS4tQxBw5hI9HYz2XQaJS2yQWi9YS1xNY9o7r9ZKU2gnc0AEwzDTZVgAUSaABF7wAFe8ZF8ZXJZDJwAAGhSFFwMByNgMAAGKEuBCCxGKfb-nA6C0JglArqugpaEAA

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid marking component styles as media with no output media directory
Issues.Body:
The logic to detect media output files was previously predicated on the presence of a media subdirectory being defined. Prior to the ability to customize output path subcomponents there was a guaranteed media subdirectory. However, now that customization is possible, there is the potential for media files to not have a distinct subdirectory in the output. To facilitate output media detection in this scenario a file extension based method is now employed. This avoids a dependence on output directory structure.

Closes #27166

Issues.Title: Update CSS/Sass import/use specifiers in application migration
Issues.Body:
When using the newly introduced migration to convert an application to use the new
esbuild-based `application` builder, CSS and Sass stylesheet will now have any import
and/or use specifiers adjusted to remove any Webpack builder specific prefixes. This includes
both the tilde and caret. Tilde usage is fully removed as package resolution is natively
supported. The caret is also removed and for each such specifier an external dependencies
entry is added to maintain existing behavior of keep the specifier unchanged.
Further, if any Sass imports are detected that assumed a workspace root path as a relative import
location then an entry is added to the `includePaths` array within the `stylePreprocessorOptions`
build option. This allows these import specifiers to continue to function.

Issues.Title: [Regression] support for optimization with intact class names (JavaScriptOptimizerOptions.keepNames)
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

15.x

### Description

While updating our main repo from angular 15 to 17, I had to find out that inside JavaScriptOptimizerPlugin, support for passing  "keepNames" option to esbuild has been removed. ( option documentation: https://esbuild.github.io/api/#keep-names )

Digging through the source code I found some comments giving insight on it not being of much use anymore for angular itself.
So I am guessing it has been removed in assumption it would not matter, because angular does not rely on class names.
Unfortunately, other 3rd party libraries may depend on class names being intact.

With the keepNames option being removed, we can only build a working app with enabling keepIdentifierNames - which will result in a whopping 30-35 % code size increase.

Allowing devs to set this flag shouldn't be problematic or complex as it is just an additional option that can be passed to esbuild.

Right now our choices are to release a heavily bloated/unoptimized app or to rip apart JavaScriptOptimizerPlugin and re-implement it on our own - just to be able to set that one option again. :( 

Please consider reintroducing support for it.

### Minimal Reproduction

Due to the kind of issue, a reproduction makes no sense.

Execute compilation of any named class with buildOptions.keepNames = true.

Angular 15 would generate minified code with intact class names.
Angular 17 will generate code with obfuscated class names.

Responsible source code:
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/15.2.10/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/webpack/plugins/javascript-optimizer-worker.ts#L174

Issues.Title: [ERROR] Could not resolve "../assets/fonts/my-font.woff"
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

16

### Description

Hello,

Previously I opened an issue because I could't build my angular design system library after upgrading it fom v16 to v17.1.0 .
I had an error when importing my font when using absolute path : [ERROR] Could not resolve "/assets/fonts/my-font.woff".

I changed the ng-packagr version from v17.1.0 to 17.2.0 and my scss import using absolute path is now working.
But if I want to use relative path "../../assets/" it still does not compile.

Is there a reason to not allow relative path in scss import ?

I use my lib in several angular applications with different base href so the absolute path does not working.



### Minimal repro

I created 2 workspaces and generated a library in each. I added a custom font in their assets folder et I import this font in their styles folder.

One workspace is generated with @angular/cli@16 and the other one with @angular/cli@17.

If i run the "npm run build" command in each
- the angular 16 build successfully
- the angular 17 throws
```
Build failed with 2 errors:
<stdin>:3:7: ERROR: Could not resolve "../assets/my-font.woff2"
<stdin>:3:53: ERROR: Could not resolve "../assets/my-font.woff"
```



Thanks in advance,

### Minimal Reproduction

-     Create an angular 17 workspace
-     Generate a design-system library
-     Add some fonts in assets folder
-     Create a styles folder :
projects / design-system /
-assets / fonts /...
-src / ...
-styles / fonts.scss

Issues.Body:
Unlike the non-ESM Node.js resolution for JS files, CSS does not have the concept of implicit file extensions. To avoid incorrectly resolving a file as CSS, stylesheet bundling no longer attempts to resolve implicit extensions. Preprocessors, such as Sass, contain logic internally that handles any specific resolution cases for their respective preprocessor and such behavior is unaffected.

Closes #27147
